summary: This document is an addendum to a journal from the Office of Legislative Counsel, dated July 6, 1978, detailing liaison activities between the CIA and House and Senate committees regarding the House Select Committee on Assassinations' (HSCA) investigation. It discusses concerns about potential exposure of sensitive CIA operations and inquiries related to former Agency employees.
summary_one_paragraph: On July 6, 1978, the Office of Legislative Counsel documented liaison activities concerning the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The journal addendum details a briefing with Thomas K. Latimer of the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence regarding concerns that the HSCA might expose sensitive CIA operations, specifically Nosenko and/or Mexico operations, in open forums. Latimer suggested a course of action involving the DCI, the President, and the Speaker of the House to address these concerns. Separately, the document notes a request from Spencer Davis of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence for contact information of former Agency employee Newton S. Miler and clarifies the Agencyâ€™s stance on its retired employees, such as [Raymond Close], who are now consultants to foreign governments, emphasizing the limitations of control post-retirement beyond existing secrecy agreements.
title: Addendum to Journal
